sources.title: Mason of the Mounted
sources.description: Canadian Mountie Mason (Bill Cody) is sent south of the border to look for a horse thief with only a watch chain for evidence. He befriends young Andy (Andy Shuford) and when Calhoun (LeRoy Mason) hits Andy, Mason and Calhoun fight. In the scuffle Calhoun's watch with the missing chain is dislodged. Mason then sets out to bring in Calhoun and his gang.

sources.title: Mason of the Mounted (1932) BILL CODY
sources.description:
Stars: Bill Cody, Andy Shuford, Nancy Drexel 
 Director: Harry L. Fraser

 Canadian Mountie Mason is sent south of the border to look for a horse thief with only a watch chain for evidence.

TRIVIA: Born William Joseph Cody on January 5, 1891, in St. Paul, Minnesota, he became a popular cowboy star during the 1920s and 1930s. Cody is often associated with the B-Western genre, where he played the heroic cowboy figure, a staple of American cinema during that period.

metadata.Plot: Canadian Mountie Mason is sent south of the border to look for a horse thief with only a watch chain for evidence. He befriends young Andy and when Calhoun hits Andy, Mason and Calhoun fight. In the scuffle Calhoun's watch with the missing chain is dislodged. Mason then sets out to bring in Calhoun and his gang.
metadata.Actors: Bill Cody, Andy Shuford, Nancy Drexel
